news.title: Inflation picks up again in June, rising at 2.7% annual rate
news.summary: Consumer price index in June was expected to increase 2.7% from a year ago, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate. The consumer price index is a measure of inflation in the United States.

news.title: JPMorgan Chase tops estimates on stronger-than-expected trading, investment banking
news.summary: JPMorgan Chase will give investors a view into how U.S. consumers and corporations fared in the second quarter. The bank will report its results on Thursday.

news.title: 'Lost their identity': Why Target is struggling to win over shoppers and investors
news.summary: Target is trying to bounce back from lower store traffic, inventory issues and customer backlash. Target has been struggling with low sales and inventory issues.

news.title: Google to invest $25 billion in data centers and AI infrastructure across largest U.S. electric grid
news.summary: Google will also spend more than $3 billion to modernize two hydropower plants in Pennsylvania to help meet growing demand from data centers in the region.

news.title: Trump's 'big beautiful' bill could add $3.4 trillion to federal deficits in the next 10 years—what it means for your wallet
news.summary: President Trump's new spending bill will increase federal deficits, adding to the debt load. The debt load has already grown more than 50% since 2020.

news.title: Wells Fargo snaps streak of revenue misses, but here’s why the stock is falling
news.summary: Wells Fargo's stock falls as net interest income misses expectations. Full-year growth outlook was lowered to offset profit and revenue beats. Wells Fargo’s stock falls.

news.title: Inflation shows biggest rise in 5 months. CPI dims slim chance of Fed rate cut in July.
news.summary: Consumer prices posted the biggest increase in June in five months. The increase is likely to keep the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates soon. There only scattered signs of tariff-related inflation.

news.title: ‘I enjoy vacations to Europe’: I’m 75, have $1 million in an IRA and $2.4 million in real estate. Why do I feel guilty?
news.summary: “When I become debilitated, I plan to end my life at Dignitas,” he says. “We have no long-term-care insurance.”

news.title: China is about to shock the U.S. economy again. Economists who predicted the first offer a plan to fight back.
news.summary: Two economics professors say the U.S. is facing another big shock from China. They say it could be worse than the first. They have a survival plan.

news.title: ASML gets a downgrade ahead of results. Key client Intel is to blame.
news.summary: ASML Holding, the microchip-equipment maker that produces the sophisticated machines used to develop semiconductors, caught a broker downgrade just ahead of its second-quarter results.
